group.description:
Software-intensive products and services permeate the fabric of modern life. The way we build software has profound implications on our society, the environment, the economy, and our everyday lives. Software artifacts are today the most complex systems we engineer. The efficient and correct construction of software is not an option, but an imperative. The ELTRUN - SENSE (Software Engineering and Security) group aims to change the way software is developed, deployed, maintained, and used. The research streams of the SENSE group include:
Software development tools and techniques
Safety, security, and availability of software systems
Software reusability and component-based development
Domain-specific languages
Vertical applications in the areas of ubiquitous computing and interactive TV
Stochastic optimisation algorithms and applications
Technology evaluation
The objectives of the SENSE group are:
Advance the state of the art in software development by realizing tools and methods for efficiently developing reliable, maintainable, and secure applications.
Examine the safety, security and availability aspects of applications and develop processes, algorithms, and environments for conducting secure and resilient transactions.
Exploit software reusability and component-based methods through development processes that capitalise on existing designs and software artefacts based on components and design patterns.
Explore the potential of domain-specific languages by designing focused, flexible, and efficient languages for expressing rules, models, processes, and applications. These are used to bridge the gap between an information systemâ€™s specification and implementation.
Study vertical applications in the areas ubiquitous computing and interactive TV by the realisation of innovative applications in emerging information technology areas that aim to push the frontier of the current state of the art.
Develop and apply stochastic optimisation algorithms, such as simulated annealing, taboo search, and genetic algorithms, applying them in the optimisation of eBusiness processes.
Evaluate technology advances in new information technologies.
